ui.clui

Class CommandLineReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.clui.CommandLineReader

  • public class CommandLineReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This method contains methods to parse command and arguments from a command line instruction. It also contains the only main method of the project, hence it is the one running the command line interface.
    Author:
    Pietro Dellino

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandLineReader() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      This method closes the scanner of the CommandLineReader.
      void interpreteCommand(java.lang.String instruction, CommandLineController clc)
      This method calls the method of the CommandLineController corresponding to the instruction.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      java.lang.String[] parseArgs(java.lang.String s)
      This method parses the arguments of a String instruction.
      Command parseCommand(java.lang.String s)
      This method parses the command of a String instruction.
      java.lang.String readCommand()
      This method asks the user a keyboard input.
      java.lang.String readCommand(java.lang.String s)
      This method prints a String on the console and asks the user a keyboard input.
